DOCNAME: CASE OF SAYGILI AND FALAKAOGLU v. TURKEY (No. 2)
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 10 - Freedom of expression -{General}
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are , respectively , the owner and the editor - in - chief of a DATE newspaper called ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE , on payment of a certain amount of money , ORG Evrensel newspaper published CARDINAL declarations by detainees who were being kept in several prisons in GPE and who were either convicted or being tried on charges of having been involved in the activities of leftwing illegal armed organisations . By these declarations the detainees protested mainly against the F - type prison system put in place by the Government . They stated , in particular , that they would go on hunger strike until the Government abolished the F - type prison system . They also made a number of other requests to the Government , such as the abrogation of PERSON no . FAC ( Anti - Terrorism Law ) , the state security courts and anti - democratic laws as well as prosecution of those who tortured detainees .

CARDINAL . The first declaration on page CARDINAL of the newspaper was entitled “ We warn the ORG which tries to put in place a cell system , we will not enter the cells ” , and in its relevant parts stated as follows :
“ As we fought off the CARDINAL DATE Junta ’s policies of controlling the prisons ,
As the circulars of DATE were torn off ,
As the LOC coffin house ( prison ) was forced to close down in DATE ,

As we forced the authorities to close down the LOC coffin house once again in DATE by our hunger strikes and we set up a barricade against the attacks on the people , DATE we the revolutionary prisoners who have come across the same duties will fight off this attack as well . We will pay off whatever it costs . But we will not enter the cells . From now on the strong voice of the resistance will resonate in the prisons of our country . As detainees of the DHKP - C and ORG ( ORG ) cases kept in various prisons , we start an indefinite hunger strike from DATE until the F - type cell assault ends and our demands are met ...
We will die but we will not enter the cells ,
Long live our general resistance ,
We will win ... ”

CARDINAL . The second declaration on page CARDINAL of the newspaper was entitled “ We are on indefinite hunger strike , we will die but we will not enter the cells ” , and stated in its relevant parts :

“ ... With these beliefs and determination , and together with the prisoners of ORG and ORG ( ORG ) cases , we started our hunger strike resistance for an indefinite period . We call on all revolutionary prisoners , including the prisoners of ORG cases , to unite under the resistance flag and to set up a stronger and indestructible barricade of revolutionist mind .
The fundamental requests of our resistance are as follows :
* Abolish F - type prisons immediately ,
* Reinstate all rights seized in prisons ,
* Abolish LAW ,
* Abolish the tripartite protocol ,
* Abolish the state security courts and invalidate the outcome of all judgments delivered by these courts , and
* Try the torturers and perpetrators of massacres .

We call on the working class , labourers , all oppressed people and revolutionary people and ask them to support us in this resistance , for which we are ready to sacrifice our lives for human honour . We call on you to fight off the cell system which is the most critical chain of assault aiming at turning our lives into cells .
We will die but we will not enter the cells !
Long live resistance , long live victory !
In the name of ORG detainees in all prisons . ”

CARDINAL . Finally , the third declaration , which appeared on page CARDINAL of the newspaper , was entitled “ To the public ” and made calls similar to the first CARDINAL declarations above . In particular , it called on all forces struggling to gain political freedom and class independence to take a stand against the fascist establishment and to spread the existing movement and actions and not to content themselves with mere declarations . It also called on these “ forces ” to use the request “ F - type prisons should be closed ” as leverage for their own political requests .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG at ORG filed an indictment charging the applicants with publishing the declarations of terrorist organisations . The charges were brought under section CARDINAL of Law no . ORG , section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL ( Press PERSON ) and Article CARDINAL of the former LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants made their defence submissions to ORG . They argued that they had merely published declarations on payment of a certain amount of money and that they had had no intention of publishing the view of any terrorist organisation . They maintained that their trial by a state security court for exercising their right to impart ideas would amount to a breach of Articles DATE Convention on Human Rights .

CARDINAL . Following the hearing of DATE , ORG convicted the applicants as charged and sentenced them to heavy fines , of MONEY ( TRL ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) and TRL MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) respectively , which sums corresponded to PERCENT of the newspaper ’s average sales in DATE . The court further decided to ban the publication of ORG for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed , arguing that they were innocent of the crime and that the sanction imposed on them was disproportionate .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG judgment , holding that the fine imposed on the applicants was miscalculated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered its reasoned judgment . Relying on LAW and the PERSON v. GPE judgment ( DATE , Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINALVII ) , the court held that publication of terrorist GPE declarations was not protected by the right to freedom of expression . It also noted that freedom of expression was not absolute and that LAW did not permit the publication of views expressed by armed terrorist organisations .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed again and asked ORG to hold a hearing and to quash ORG judgment of DATE . They claimed that the incriminated declarations did not incite violence or harm national security . They only exercised their duty to impart political opinions . The applicants also challenged the constitution of the state security courts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ request for a hearing and upheld the judgment of ORG .
